lines.line: Arr, Matey!
I'm in search of treasure.
Arr, treasure you be after eh? Well I might be able to tell you where to find some... For a price...
What sort of price?
Well for example if you can get me a bottle of rum... Not just any rum mind...
I'd like some rum made on Karamja Island. There's no rum like Karamja Rum!
Would some Braindeath 'Rum' do?
Gadzooks, that swill! Not a chance!
It's Karamja Rum or no deal.
Ok, I will bring you some rum.
Yer a saint, although it'll take a miracle to get it off Karamja.
What do you mean?
The Customs office has been clampin' down on the export of spirits. You seem like a resourceful young lad, I'm sure ye'll be able to find a way to slip the stuff past them.
Well I'll give it a shot.
Arr, that's the spirit!
Not right now.
Fair enough. I'll still be here and thirsty whenever you feel like helpin' out.
Have ye brought some rum for yer ol' mate Frank?
No, not yet.
Not surprising, tis no easy task to get it off Karamja.
Well I'll give it another shot.
Hello I'm Luthas, I run the banana plantation here.
Could you offer me employment on your plantation?
Yes, I can sort something out. There's a crate ready to be loaded onto the ship.
You wouldn't believe the demand for bananas from Wydin's shop over in Port Sarim. I think this is the third crate I've shipped him this month..
If you could fill it up with bananas, I'll pay you 30 gold.
That customs officer is annoying isn't she?
Well I know her pretty well. She doesn't cause me any trouble any more.
She doesn't even search my export crates any more. She knows they only contain bananas.
Really? How interesting. Whereabouts do you send those to?
There is a little shop over in Port Sarim that buys them up by the crate. I believe it is run by a man called Wydin.
I've filled a crate with bananas.
Well done, here's your payment.
Will you pay me for another crate full?
Yes certainly.
If you go outside you should see the old crate has been loaded on to the ship, and there is another empty crate in its place.
Thank you, I'll be on my way.
So where are these bananas going to be delivered to?
I sell them to Wydin who runs a grocery store in Port Sarim.
Can I help you?
Can I journey on this ship?
You need to be searched before you can board.
Why?
Because Asgarnia has banned the import of intoxicating spirits.
Search away, I have nothing to hide.
Aha, trying to smuggle rum are we?
Umm... it's for personal use?
This is not the Karamja rum you are looking for.
This is not the Karamja rum we are looking for.
Well that was easy!
Drat...
Well you've got some odd stuff, but it's all legal. Now you need to pay a boarding charge of 30 coins.
Ok.
Oh dear, I don't seem to have enough money.
Oh, I'll not bother then.
You're not putting your hands on my things!
You're not getting on this ship then.
You don't need to look through my things.
Oh, I think I do. If you don't want to let me search your possessions, then you're not coming aboard this ship.
Does Karamja have any unusual customs then?
I'm not that sort of customs officer.
Don't you know? You can get into trouble for giving alcohol to minors, and I'm pretty small, it has to be said.
Welcome to my food store! Would you like to buy anything?
Can I get a job here?
Well, you're keen, I'll give you that. Okay, I'll give you a go. Have you got your own white apron?
Yes, I have one right here.
Wow - you are well prepared! You're hired. Go through to the back and tidy up for me, please.
You need to put your white apron on first though.
No, I haven't.
Well, you can't work here unless you have a white apron. Health and safety regulations, you understand.
Where can I get one of those?
Well, I get all of mine over at the clothing shop in Varrock. They sell them cheap there.
Oh, and I'm sure that I've seen a spare one over in Gerrant's fish store somewhere. It's the little place just north of here.
Hey, you can't go in there. Only employees of the grocery store can go in.
Sorry, I didn't realise.
Can you put your white apron on before going in there, please?
Is it nice and tidy round the back now?
Yes, can I work out front now?
No, I'm the one who works here.
Yes, are you going to pay me yet?
Umm... No, not yet.
No, it's a complete mess.
Ah well, it'll give you something to do, won't it.
Can I buy something please?
Yes, of course.
Yes, I've got some.
Arr - this here rum's got a banana stuck in it!
Arr - I don't likes banana in me rum!
Now a deal's a deal, I'll tell ye about the treasure. I used to serve under a pirate captain called One-Eyed Hector.
Hector were very successful and became very rich. But about a year ago we were boarded by the Customs and Excise Agents.
Hector were killed along with many of the crew, I were one of the few to escape and I escaped with this.
This be Hector's key. I believe it opens his chest in his old room in the Blue Moon Inn in Varrock.
With any luck his treasure will be in there.
Ok thanks, I'll go and get it.
So why didn't you ever get it?
I'm not allowed in the Blue Moon Inn. Apparently I'm a drunken trouble maker.
Frank, I have some Karamja Rum.
I seem to have lost my chest key...
Arr, silly you. Fortunately I took the precaution to have another one made.
First moles, now this! Take this, vandal!
I have the treasure, would you like a share?
No lad, you got it fair and square.
You enjoy it. It's what Hector would have wanted.

characters.name: Redbeard Frank
characters.description: Middle-aged male pirate, rough gravelly voice with a strong seafaring accent, jovial but shrewd personality. Former first mate of the legendary One-Eyed Hector, now a captain himself with an insatiable thirst for Karamjan rum.

characters.name: Luthas
characters.description: Middle-aged male, Caribbean-influenced accent, warm and friendly tone. A hardworking banana plantation owner on Karamja who is practical and business-minded, always accompanied by his pet monkey.

characters.name: Customs officer
characters.description: Adult female, formal British accent, stern and authoritative tone. A diligent law enforcement officer who takes her job seriously, enforcing Asgarnia's ban on importing spirits from Karamja.

characters.name: Wydin
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, businesslike and slightly impatient tone. A practical shopkeeper who runs a food store in Port Sarim, focused on efficiency and proper workplace attire.

characters.name: Gardener
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, frustrated and aggressive tone. A grumpy groundskeeper in Falador Park who is fed up with vandals and pests disturbing his carefully maintained gardens.

characters.name: Imp
characters.description: Youthful male, high-pitched mischievous voice with a cheeky tone. A small demonic creature known for causing minor trouble and making witty, self-deprecating remarks about its size.
